laboratory_examinations.findings: 50% (normal range, 41-53) prior to the motor vehicle accident; 36% (normal range, 41-53) two days after the accident; 18% on the day of admission to the other hospital; 17.6% on admission to this hospital; increased to 21.7% by hospital day 3.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Decreasing levels from 50% to 17.6% before stabilizing at 21.7% on hospital day 3.

laboratory_examinations.findings: 17 g/dL before motor vehicle accident; 13 g/dL two days after the accident; 6 g/dL on day of admission; 5.8 g/dL on admission to this hospital; increased to 7.3 g/dL by hospital day 3.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Decreasing levels from 17 g/dL to 5.8 g/dL before increasing to 7.3 g/dL by hospital day 3.

laboratory_examinations.findings: 9.8 million/mm³ before the accident; 8.4 million/mm³ two days after the accident; 9.2 million/mm³ on day of admission; 9 million/mm³ on admission to this hospital; 7 million/mm³ by hospital day 3.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Slight decrease from 9.8 million/mm³ to 7 million/mm³ over the sequence of evaluations.

laboratory_examinations.findings: 193,000/mm³ before the accident; 22,000/mm³ two days after the accident; 13,000/mm³ on day of admission; 15,000/mm³ on admission to this hospital; 17,000/mm³ by hospital day 3.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Decreasing levels from 193,000/mm³ to 15,000/mm³ before a slight increase to 17,000/mm³.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Normal range, NA at first; 6% noted post-accident; 16.2% on admission to the hospital.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased from NA to 16.2% by hospital admission.

laboratory_examinations.findings: 711 U/L prior to admission; increased to 1122 U/L during hospital stay; peaked at 1150 U/L.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Increasing levels from 711 U/L to a peak of 1150 U/L during the hospital stay.
